smell_analysis.justification: All diagrams in the PDF contain visual elements; no empty diagrams were found.
All use cases are associated with actors, either directly or via 'include' relationships to use cases that are connected to actors.
No use cases with synonymous names associated with the same actor were found.
No package diagram displays multiple model elements with the same name within the same package.
No redundant data value storage (denormalization) without foreign keys was detected in the class or database diagrams.
Use case naming is consistent; all use cases start with an active verb (e.g., 'Vaata', 'Registreeri', 'Tuvasta').
All states in the state diagram (Page 9) are reachable through transitions.
All actions in the activity diagram (Page 4) are reachable via the control flow.
All relationships in class and database diagrams have multiplicity indicators at both ends.
No single diagram contains 10 or more central elements (classes, tables, use cases, or states).
No single class or table has 6 or more visual connection lines on any single diagram.
The layout of elements is reasonably uniform; no related elements are excessively distant.
All use cases and activity actions start with active verbs (e.g., 'Vaata', 'Otsi', 'Lõpeta').
No element names with 3 or fewer characters were found (excluding standard abbreviations like 'PK').
All class names start with an uppercase letter and are singular (e.g., 'Isik', 'Auto').
On the class diagram 'Autode register (Isik)' (Page 11), the class 'Auto' contains attributes that start with an uppercase letter: 'Reg_aeg', 'Reg_number', and 'Vin_kood'.
No Hungarian notation or type prefixes (like 'tbl_', 'str') were found in element names.
